Hello all,

Firstly, I want to say that this is a fantastic forum! I have b=
een
using it for only one year now but in that short space of time you
have=
 all helped me not only to write better tests but to also be a
better devel=
oper.

Now to my problem :-) I searched for a solution to this but all in
v=
ain. Essentially I want to execute a JUNIT test on a unix box
remotely whil=
e connecting to the JVM using eclipse on my windows
machine with the intent=
ion of debugging.

How do I launch my JUNIT with a debug option on the comm=
and line? I
don't want to use ANT. The problem I have is that we develop on=

windows but the application is designed to run solely on some
different fl=
avours of unix (mostly HP-UX). 

All our tests run automatically at night a=
fter the daily build but
sometimes the tests will fail on unix and pass on =
windows. Ideally,
the solution would be to develop and test on unix but thi=
s is not
permitted due certain limitations beyond my control.

Any help wou=
ld be very much appreciated. 
regards,
David.
